intro: Senecio culciklattii, commonly known as the Cretan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the island of Crete in Greece. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Senecio culciklattii is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
